Definition.WordDefinition: Chest (Heb. _'aron_, generally rendered "ark"), the coffer into which the contributions for the repair of the temple were put (2 Kings 12:9, 10; 2 Chr. 24:8, 10, 11). In Gen. 50:26 it is rendered "coffin." In Ezek. 27:24 a different Hebrew word, _genazim_ (plur.), is used. It there means "treasure-chests."

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Chest \Chest\ (ch[e^]st), n. [OE. chest, chist, AS. cest, cist, cyst, L. cista, fr. Gr. ki`sth. Cf. {Cist}, {Cistern}.] 1. A large box of wood, or other material, having, like a trunk, a lid, but no covering of skin, leather, or cloth. [1913 Webster]
Heaps of money crowded in the chest. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
2. A coffin. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
He is now dead and mailed in his cheste. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
3. The part of the body inclosed by the ribs and breastbone; the thorax. [1913 Webster]
4. (Com.) A case in which certain goods, as tea, opium, etc., are transported; hence, the quantity which such a case contains. [1913 Webster]
5. (Mech.) A tight receptacle or box, usually for holding gas, steam, liquids, etc.; as, the steam chest of an engine; the wind chest of an organ. [1913 Webster]
{Bomb chest}, See under {Bomb}.
{Chest of drawers}, a case or movable frame containing drawers. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Chest \Chest\ (ch[e^]st), v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Chested}.] 1. To deposit in a chest; to hoard. [1913 Webster]
2. To place in a coffin. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
He dieth and is chested. --Gen. 1. 26 (heading). [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chest \Chest\ (ch[e^]st), n. [AS. ce['a]st.] Strife; contention; controversy. [Obs.] --P. Plowman. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: CHEST Computers in Higher Education Software Team (org., UK)

chest n 1: the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates [syn: {thorax}, {pectus}] 2: box with a lid; used for storage; usually large and sturdy 3: furniture with drawers for keeping clothes [syn: {chest of drawers}, {bureau}, {dresser}]
